results.title: Let's hear it for the girls
results.creator_credit: Belinda, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Belinda pays tribute to her gang of girlfriends, whom she met at age 12. Fifteen years on, life has changed, but the ‘girls’ are still always there for each other.

results.title: Let me explain...
results.creator_credit: Samantha Van Zanen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Van Zanen’s story starts with a dramatic childbirth but mostly reflects on the darkest years of her life as she coped with having Turner’s Syndrome. The bullying, needles and anguish were alleviated somewhat by her family and close friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samantha Van Zanen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Later in life
results.creator_credit: Robert Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Robert Hill’s family, three of them have a disability, all diagnosed later in life. Despite their various stuggles, the Hill family have pulled each other through and will continue to do so.

results.title: Through the years
results.creator_credit: Marita Kent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being diagnosed with Turner’s Syndrome, Marita Kent was determined to live a normal life. Looking back over the years, Kent has much to be proud and happy about.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marita Kent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being diagnosed with Turner’s Syndrome, Marita Kent was determined to live a normal life. Looking back over the years, Kent has much to be proud and happy about.
description_for_label: Despite being diagnosed with Turner’s Syndrome, Marita Kent was determined to live a normal life. Looking back over the years, Kent has much to be proud and happy about.

results.title: What a whirlwind relationship!
results.creator_credit: Lucy Pucci, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Two months into their relationship, Lucy Pucci told her partner that she has Turner’s Syndrome and won’t be able to have children. He stuck by her then, just as he has stuck by her through their various agonising attempts to have children of their own.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucy Pucci, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Two months into their relationship, Lucy Pucci told her partner that she has Turner’s Syndrome and won’t be able to have children. He stuck by her then, just as he has stuck by her through their various agonising attempts to have children of their own.
description_for_label: Two months into their relationship, Lucy Pucci told her partner that she has Turner’s Syndrome and won’t be able to have children. He stuck by her then, just as he has stuck by her through their various agonising attempts to have children of their own.

results.title: Good things come in small packages
results.creator_credit: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sam came up to Leeanne Hill and asked her for a hug, a friendship started that has only become stronger over the years. These best friends are there for each other through everything, including Hill’s struggle with Turner’s Syndrome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Turning perceptions
results.creator_credit: Karlene Lynch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Karlene Lynch found out when she was 21 that she had Turner’s Syndrome. Despite the agony of being infertile and the health difficulties, Lynch has led a happy and inspiring life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karlene Lynch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Turner's Syndrome : trials and triumphs
results.creator_credit: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.

results.title: Diary of a backpack
results.creator_credit: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
